name: Modules.ACA
summary: Add-on module that provides support for real-time crash reporting services.

methods.name: getOptOutStatus
methods.summary: Returns true if the user opt out to send information else returns false.

methods.name: leaveBreadcrumb
methods.summary: Leaves a breadcrumb trail in your code to get a playback of events leading up to a crash.
methods.description: These breadcrumbs are collected and passed to the ACA service. The most recent 100 breadcrumbs before the crash occurred are displayed on the ACA Dashboard.

parameters.name: breadcrumb
parameters.summary: Up to 140 characters to identify the event or application state.

parameters.name: data
parameters.summary: JSON data payload to send with breadcrumb.

methods.name: setBreadcrumbLimit
methods.summary: Sets the breadcrumb event limit for crash reports. This will limit the number of breadcrumb events sent when a crash report occurs.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.summary: Limit can be set to a maximum of 100.

methods.name: setMetadata
methods.summary: Used to set a single pair of arbitrary user metadata.
methods.description: The data is passed into the crash event.

parameters.name: key
parameters.summary: Metadata key or JSON object to merge into metadata.

methods.name: setOptOutStatus
methods.summary: Sets the users opt-out status from sending any and all information to the ACA service.

parameters.name: optOutStatus
parameters.summary: If set to true, data is not sent to the ACA service.

methods.name: setUsername
methods.summary: Sets a username to differentiate user metadata for crash reports.
methods.description: Updates only if there has been a change to the username from previous settings.

parameters.name: username
parameters.summary: Up to 32 characters to set to identify a user.
